title: Bariatric Surgery Coverage Guidelines
content:
Bariatric surgery coverage is provided for members meeting the following criteria:

1. BMI Requirements:
   - BMI ≥ 40 (severe obesity), OR
   - BMI ≥ 35 with at least one obesity-related comorbidity (e.g., type 2 diabetes, hypertension, sleep apnea)

2. Age Requirements:
   - Members must be 18 years or older
   - Special consideration for members under 18 with severe complications

3. Documentation Requirements:
   - Documented weight history for at least 6 months
   - Participation in medically supervised weight loss program
   - Psychological evaluation completed
   - Nutritional counseling received

4. Prior Authorization:
   - Required for all bariatric surgery procedures
   - Submit authorization request at least 14 days before scheduled surgery

5. Covered Procedures:
   - Gastric bypass (Roux-en-Y)
   - Sleeve gastrectomy
   - Adjustable gastric banding
   - Biliopancreatic diversion with duodenal switch

6. Exclusions:
   - Revision procedures (unless medically necessary)
   - Cosmetic procedures following weight loss
   - Experimental or investigational procedures

sections.coverage criteria: BMI ≥ 40 or BMI ≥ 35 with comorbidities. Age 18+. Must complete 6-month supervised weight loss program.
sections.prior authorization: Required. Submit 14 days before surgery. Include weight history, psychological evaluation, and nutritional counseling documentation.
sections.covered procedures: Gastric bypass, sleeve gastrectomy, adjustable gastric banding, biliopancreatic diversion with duodenal switch
sections.exclusions: Revision procedures (unless medically necessary), cosmetic procedures, experimental procedures

title: MRI and Advanced Imaging Prior Authorization Requirements
content:
Prior authorization is required for the following advanced imaging services:

1. MRI (Magnetic Resonance Imaging):
   - Brain MRI: Authorization required for non-emergent cases
   - Spine MRI: Required for all lumbar, thoracic, and cervical spine imaging
   - Joint MRI: Required for shoulder, knee, hip, ankle imaging
   - Abdominal/Pelvic MRI: Authorization required

2. CT Scans:
   - CT Angiography: Prior authorization required
   - Cardiac CT: Authorization required
   - Full-body CT screening: Not covered (screening purposes)

3. PET Scans:
   - Oncology PET scans: Authorization required
   - Cardiac PET: Prior authorization needed
   - Brain PET: Authorization required for dementia workup

4. Authorization Process:
   - Submit request online through provider portal
   - Include clinical notes and diagnostic justification
   - Response within 2 business days for routine cases
   - Same-day response for urgent cases

5. Clinical Criteria:
   - Conservative treatment attempted (when applicable)
   - Imaging will change treatment plan
   - Less costly alternative not appropriate
   - Clinical indication documented

6. Exemptions from Prior Authorization:
   - Emergency department imaging
   - Inpatient imaging
   - Imaging for active cancer treatment monitoring

sections.coverage determination: Prior authorization required for MRI, CT angiography, PET scans. Emergency and inpatient imaging exempt.
sections.authorization process: Submit online via provider portal with clinical notes. 2-day response for routine, same-day for urgent.
sections.clinical criteria: Conservative treatment attempted, imaging will change treatment, clinical indication documented

title: Genetic Testing Coverage - BRCA and Hereditary Cancer
content:
Genetic testing for hereditary cancer syndromes is covered when medical necessity criteria are met.

1. BRCA1/BRCA2 Testing Coverage:
   - Personal history of breast cancer diagnosed before age 50
   - Personal history of ovarian cancer at any age
   - Personal history of triple-negative breast cancer before age 60
   - Family history of BRCA-related cancer in first-degree relative
   - Ashkenazi Jewish ancestry with breast/ovarian cancer history

2. Multi-Gene Panel Testing:
   - Covered when BRCA testing criteria are met
   - Must include genes relevant to personal/family cancer history
   - Maximum of one panel test per lifetime (unless new diagnosis)

3. Lynch Syndrome Testing:
   - Personal history of colorectal cancer before age 50
   - Family history meeting Amsterdam II criteria
   - Tumor screening (MSI/IHC) positive results

4. Prior Authorization:
   - Required for all genetic testing
   - Submit with detailed family history (at least 3 generations)
   - Include genetic counseling documentation

5. Genetic Counseling Requirements:
   - Pre-test genetic counseling required
   - Post-test counseling recommended
   - Counseling must be by certified genetic counselor or geneticist

6. Limitations:
   - Testing limited to affected individual first
   - Cascade testing for family members covered after proband identified
   - Direct-to-consumer testing not covered
   - Repeat testing not covered without new clinical indication

sections.coverage criteria: BRCA testing: breast cancer <50, ovarian cancer any age, triple-negative <60, family history, Ashkenazi Jewish ancestry. Lynch syndrome: colorectal cancer <50, Amsterdam criteria, positive tumor screening.
sections.prior authorization: Required. Submit with 3-generation family history and genetic counseling documentation.
sections.limitations: Test affected individual first. Cascade testing for family covered. No direct-to-consumer testing. No repeat testing without new indication.

title: Physical Therapy and Rehabilitation Services
content:
Coverage for physical therapy and rehabilitation services is provided as follows:

1. Outpatient Physical Therapy:
   - Covered for acute injury or post-surgical rehabilitation
   - Chronic condition management when functional improvement expected
   - Maximum 30 visits per calendar year (standard plans)
   - Additional visits may be authorized for severe injuries

2. Prior Authorization:
   - NOT required for first 12 visits
   - Authorization required after 12 visits
   - Must demonstrate functional improvement to continue

3. Covered Conditions:
   - Post-surgical rehabilitation (joint replacement, ligament repair)
   - Acute musculoskeletal injuries
   - Stroke rehabilitation
   - Neurological conditions (Parkinson's, MS, spinal cord injury)
   - Balance and gait disorders
   - Sports injuries

4. Documentation Requirements:
   - Initial evaluation with functional assessment
   - Treatment plan with measurable goals
   - Progress notes every 4 visits
   - Re-evaluation at 12 visits if continuing

5. Maintenance Therapy:
   - Generally not covered
   - Exception: Progressive neurological conditions
   - Exception: Prevention of functional decline in chronic conditions

6. Home Health Physical Therapy:
   - Covered when homebound status documented
   - Requires physician order
   - Limited to specific medical conditions

sections.coverage determination: Covered for acute injury, post-surgical rehab, chronic conditions with expected improvement. 30 visits per year standard. No prior auth for first 12 visits.
sections.authorization: Required after 12 visits. Must show functional improvement.
sections.limitations: Maintenance therapy generally not covered except progressive neurological conditions. Home health requires homebound status.

title: Sleep Studies and CPAP Coverage
content:
Coverage for sleep studies and continuous positive airway pressure (CPAP) therapy:

1. Home Sleep Studies:
   - Covered for suspected obstructive sleep apnea (OSA)
   - No prior authorization required
   - Clinical symptoms must be documented (snoring, daytime sleepiness, witnessed apneas)

2. In-Lab Polysomnography:
   - Prior authorization required
   - Covered when home sleep study inconclusive or not appropriate
   - Covered for suspected central sleep apnea, parasomnia, narcolepsy
   - Split-night studies covered when appropriate

3. CPAP Equipment:
   - Covered following diagnosis of OSA (AHI ≥ 5)
   - Initial rental period: 90 days
   - Purchase after demonstrating compliance (≥4 hours/night for 70% of nights)

4. CPAP Supplies:
   - Mask: Covered every 3 months
   - Tubing: Covered every 3 months
   - Filters: Covered monthly (disposable) or every 6 months (reusable)
   - Headgear: Covered every 6 months

5. Compliance Requirements:
   - Download CPAP usage data at 30 days and 90 days
   - Must use ≥4 hours per night for ≥70% of nights in 30-day period
   - Non-compliance may result in termination of coverage

6. CPAP Replacement:
   - Complete system replacement: Every 5 years
   - Mask replacement: Every 3 months with compliance
   - Early replacement requires documentation of loss, theft, or damage

sections.coverage criteria: Home sleep studies: no prior auth, requires OSA symptoms. In-lab polysomnography: prior auth required for inconclusive home study, central sleep apnea, parasomnia, narcolepsy.
sections.cpap coverage: Covered for AHI ≥5. 90-day rental then purchase with compliance (≥4 hours/night 70% of nights). Supplies every 3-6 months.
sections.compliance requirements: Download data at 30 and 90 days. Must use ≥4 hours/night for ≥70% of nights. Non-compliance may terminate coverage.
